HARMLESS.Definition: not dangerous; not able to hurt anyone

SCANDAL.Definition: a shocking event that made people angry

NEWSWORTHY.Definition: important or interesting enough to be in the news

PUDDLES.Definition: small pools of water on the ground

BUDGETS.Definition: plans for how to spend money

CONFRONTED WITH.Definition: faced with; having to deal with

MUTTER.Definition: speak quietly in a low, unclear voice

WENT VIRAL.Definition: became very popular online very fast

POWERWASHED.Definition: cleaned using a machine that sprays strong water

POWER WASHER.Definition: a machine that sprays strong water to clean things

CONFESS.Definition: say something honestly, even if it is embarrassing

CATHARTIC.Definition: making you feel better after strong emotions

OUT OF THE GOODNESS OF HIS OWN HEART.Definition: out of personal generosity and not because he wanted to get something for himself

BANDWAGON.Definition: something many people join or copy because it is popular

GRAVY.Definition: a sauce made from meat juices

BROWNISH.Definition: a colour that is a bit like brown

LUXURIOUSLY.Definition: in a very comfortable or fancy way

TEXTURE.Definition: the feel, appearance, or consistency of the substance

MELTS.Definition: becomes soft or turns to liquid

SIDEKICK.Definition: something that goes with the main thing

CONNOISSEURS.Definition: people who know a lot about good food

PROSPECT.Definition: the idea of something that might happen

RADISH.Definition: a small round red or white vegetable

SQUASH.Definition: a large vegetable like a pumpkin

FAIR WITH A FORK-LIFT TRUCK.Definition: the festival or gathering using a machine that lifts heavy things

WREAK HAVOC.Definition: cause a lot of trouble or damage

REELED IN.Definition: pulled in with a fishing line

UNCANNILY.Definition: strangely; in a way that seemed too real

PROSTHETIC.Definition: artificial; made to replace a body part

REUNION.Definition: an instance of them coming together

PLUMBING.Definition: the pipes for water in the building

TRIAL.Definition: the meeting in court to decide if he was guilty

LIGHTHEARTEDLY.Definition: in a fun, relaxed, not serious way

SHINY.Definition: bright because of being clean and smooth
